tools.name: Add member to project
tools.description: Adds an existing user to a project (identified by `project_id` within organization `org_id`), assigning a valid system role.

org_id.description: Identifier of the organization owning the project.
org_id.title: Org Id

project_id.description: Identifier of the project to add the member to.
project_id.title: Project Id

role.description: Role defining the new member's project permissions (e.g., 'Admin', 'Editor').
role.title: Role

username.description: Username of the user to add to the project.
username.title: Username

inputParameters.title: AddMemberToProjectRequest
inputParameters.description: Specifies the organization, project, username, and role for adding a new member to a project.

message.description: Confirmation message indicating the user was successfully added to the project. Typically returns 'User added to the project successfully.'
message.title: Message

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Add new memory records
tools.description: Stores new memory records from a list of messages, optionally inferring structured content; requires association via `agent_id`, `user_id`, `app_id`, or `run_id`.

agent_id.description: Unique identifier for the agent associated with this memory.
agent_id.title: Agent Id

app_id.description: Unique identifier for the application associated with this memory.
app_id.title: App Id

excludes.description: Comma-separated keywords to exclude specific topics, aiding in filtering out irrelevant information.
excludes.title: Excludes

includes.description: Comma-separated keywords to include specific topics, aiding filtering and prioritization.
includes.title: Includes

infer.description: If true, infers structured memories from messages; otherwise, stores messages directly.
infer.title: Infer

messages.description: List of message objects forming the memory's content, representing conversations or multi-part memories.
messages.title: Messages

items.description: A message object with a role and content, used to form the content of a memory.
items.title: MessagesRequest

content.description: The textual content of the message.
content.title: Content

role.description: The role of the message sender, e.g., 'user' or 'assistant'.
role.title: Role

org_id.description: Optional unique identifier for the organization associated with this memory.
org_id.title: Org Id

org_name.description: The name of the organization for this memory. Deprecated: use `org_id` instead.
org_name.title: Org Name

output_format.description: Specifies the response output format. 'v1.1' offers enhanced detail; 'v1.0' (default) will be deprecated.
output_format.title: Output Format

project_id.description: Optional unique identifier for the project associated with this memory.
project_id.title: Project Id

project_name.description: The name of the project for this memory. Deprecated: use `project_id` instead.
project_name.title: Project Name

run_id.description: Unique identifier for the run associated with this memory.
run_id.title: Run Id

user_id.description: Unique identifier for the user associated with this memory.
user_id.title: User Id

inputParameters.title: AddNewMemoryRecordsRequest
inputParameters.description: Request schema for `AddNewMemoryRecords`

relations.description: Array of related entities and relationships from the graph store. Only present when graph memory is enabled (enable_graph: true). Contains entity-relationship triplets in the format (source, relation, destination).
relations.title: Relations

items.description: Represents a relationship between entities in the graph store (only present when graph memory is enabled).
items.title: GraphRelation

destination.description: Name of the destination entity node in the relationship.
destination.title: Destination

destination_id.description: Element ID of the destination node in the graph database.
destination_id.title: Destination Id

relation_id.description: Element ID of the relationship edge in the graph database.
relation_id.title: Relation Id

relationship.description: Type of relationship between source and destination entities.
relationship.title: Relationship

source.description: Name of the source entity node in the relationship.
source.title: Source

source_id.description: Element ID of the source node in the graph database.
source_id.title: Source Id

results.description: Array of memory event objects containing the processed memories. This field is present in v1.1+ format and when using the OSS library.
results.title: Results

items.description: Represents a single memory event in the add memories response.
items.title: MemoryEvent

actor_id.description: Optional identifier of the actor who performed the action. Used for query-time filtering in multi-actor scenarios.
actor_id.title: Actor Id

data.description: Container object holding the processed memory information when the memory field is not directly present. Contains a 'memory' key with the memory text.
data.title: Data

event.description: Event type indicator. Possible values: 'ADD' (new memory created), 'UPDATE' (existing memory modified), 'DELETE' (memory invalidated), or 'NONE' (no change).
event.title: Event

id.description: Unique identifier for the memory event (e.g., 'mem_01JF8ZS4Y0R0SPM13R5R6H32CJ'). Can be persisted for auditing purposes.
id.title: Id

memory.description: The extracted or inferred memory text content that will be stored (e.g., 'The user moved to Austin in 2025.').
memory.title: Memory

previous_memory.description: For UPDATE events, contains the previous memory content before the update. Also referred to as 'old_memory' in some contexts.
previous_memory.title: Previous Memory

role.description: The message role associated with the memory (e.g., 'user', 'assistant').
role.title: Role

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Add organization member
tools.description: Adds a new member, who must be a registered user, to an organization, assigning them a specific role.

email.description: The email of the user to be added to the organization.
email.title: Email

org_id.description: Unique identifier of the organization to which the member will be added.
org_id.title: Org Id

role.description: The role (should be in uppercase) to be assigned to the user within the organization (allowed values: 'OWNER' and 'READER'). This dictates the user's permissions.
role.title: Role

inputParameters.title: AddOrganizationMemberRequest
inputParameters.description: Request schema for adding a new member to an organization by specifying their email and desired role.

message.description: Confirmation message indicating successful member addition to the organization.
message.title: Message

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Create a new agent
tools.description: Creates a new agent with a unique `agent_id` and an optional `name`; additional metadata may be assigned by the system.

agent_id.description: Unique identifier for the agent, used for referencing in subsequent API calls.
agent_id.title: Agent Id

name.description: Human-readable name for the agent, used for display or easier identification.
name.title: Name

inputParameters.title: CreateANewAgentRequest
inputParameters.description: Request payload for creating a new agent.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the agent was created in ISO 8601 date-time format
created_at.title: Created At

id.description: Unique identifier for the agent entity
id.title: Id

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with the agent
metadata.title: Metadata

total_memories.description: Total number of memories associated with the agent
total_memories.title: Total Memories

type.description: Type of entity. For agent entities, this will be 'agent'.
type.title: Type

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the agent was last updated in ISO 8601 date-time format
updated_at.title: Updated At

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Create a new agent run
tools.description: Creates a new agent run in the mem0.ai system.

name.description: Human-readable name for the agent run.
name.title: Name

run_id.description: Client-defined identifier for the agent run. Should be unique for distinct identification.
run_id.title: Run Id

inputParameters.title: CreateANewAgentRunRequest
inputParameters.description: Request to create a new agent run.

agentId.description: Identifier of the agent associated with this run.
agentId.title: Agent Id

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the run was created, in ISO 8601 date-time format.
createdAt.title: Created At

id.description: Unique identifier for the run in UUID format.
id.title: Id

metadata.description: Additional contextual data and custom attributes associated with the run.
metadata.title: Metadata

name.description: Name or identifier for the run.
name.title: Name

organization.description: Identifier of the organization that owns this run.
organization.title: Organization

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the run was last updated, in ISO 8601 date-time format.
updatedAt.title: Updated At

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Create a new application
tools.description: Creates a new application, allowing metadata to be passed in the request body (not an explicit field in this action's request model); ensure `app_id` is unique to avoid potential errors or unintended updates.

app_id.description: The unique identifier for the application to be created. This ID will be used to reference the application in subsequent API calls.
app_id.title: App Id

name.description: An optional, human-readable name for the application. If not provided, the application might be created without a specific name or with a default one.
name.title: Name

inputParameters.title: CreateANewApplicationRequest
inputParameters.description: Input model for the `CreateANewApplication` action, specifying the parameters required to create a new application.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the application was created.
created_at.title: Created At

id.description: Unique identifier for the application.
id.title: Id

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with the application.
metadata.title: Metadata

total_memories.description: Total number of memories associated with the application.
total_memories.title: Total Memories

type.description: Type of the entity. For applications, this value would be 'app'.
type.title: Type

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the application was last updated.
updated_at.title: Updated At

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

name.description: The name for the new organization.
name.title: Name

message.description: Confirmation text stating that the organization was created successfully.
message.title: Message

org_id.description: Unique identifier for the organization in UUID format.
org_id.title: Org Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.description: Creates a new user with the specified unique `user_id` and supports associating `metadata` (not part of the request schema fields).

user_id.description: The unique identifier for the new user. This ID will be used for future references to this user.
user_id.title: User Id

inputParameters.title: CreateANewUserRequest
inputParameters.description: Request schema for creating a new user.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the entity was created (ISO 8601 format)
created_at.title: Created At

id.description: Unique identifier for the entity
id.title: Id

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with the entity

total_memories.description: Total number of memories associated with the entity
total_memories.title: Total Memories

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the entity was last updated (ISO 8601 format)
updated_at.title: Updated At

tools.name: Create an export job with schema
tools.description: Initiates an asynchronous job to export memories, structured by a schema provided in the request body and allowing optional filters.

app_id.description: Filters memories for export; if provided, only memories from this application are included.
app_id.title: App Id

org_id.description: Filters memories for export; if provided, only memories from this organization are included.
org_id.title: Org Id

project_id.description: Filters memories for export; if provided, only memories from this project are included.
project_id.title: Project Id

run_id.description: Filters memories for export; if provided, only memories from this run are included.
run_id.title: Run Id

session_id.description: Filters memories for export; if provided, only memories from this session are included.
session_id.title: Session Id

user_id.description: Filters memories for export; if provided, only memories of this user are included.
user_id.title: User Id

inputParameters.title: CreateAnExportJobWithSchemaRequest
inputParameters.description: Specifies optional filters for an export job. Note: a 'schema' parameter (defining exported data structure) must be supplied in the request body, though not explicitly a field in this model.

id.description: Unique identifier (UUID format) for the export job, used to retrieve the export results once processing is complete.
id.title: Id

message.description: Status message confirming that the memory export request has been received and will be ready shortly.
message.title: Message

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Create memory entry
tools.description: Lists/searches existing memory entries with filtering and pagination; critically, this action retrieves memories and does *not* create new ones, despite its name.

filters.description: Key-value pairs to filter memories (e.g., 'user_id', 'custom_data.key'), enabling complex, multi-field searches.
filters.title: Filters

org_id.description: Unique organization ID to filter memories. Preferred over the deprecated `org_name`.
org_id.title: Org Id

org_name.description: DEPRECATED: Organization name to filter memories. Use `org_id` instead for improved stability and future compatibility.
org_name.title: Org Name

page_size.description: Number of memory entries per page.
page_size.title: Page Size

project_id.description: Unique project ID to filter memories. Preferred over the deprecated `project_name`.
project_id.title: Project Id

project_name.description: DEPRECATED: Project name to filter memories. Use `project_id` instead for improved stability and future compatibility.
project_name.title: Project Name

inputParameters.title: CreateMemoryEntryRequest
inputParameters.description: Request schema to list/search memory entries with filtering and pagination. Note: this operation lists/searches memories, not creates new ones.

results.description: Array of memory events queued for asynchronous processing.
results.title: Results

items.description: Memory event object representing a queued asynchronous memory operation.
items.title: MemoryEvent

data.description: Container object holding memory operation results.
data.title: Data

memory.description: The generated or extracted memory text that was stored (e.g., 'The user moved to Austin in 2025.').
memory.title: Memory

event.description: Event type indicating the operation performed. Possible values: 'ADD' (new memory created), 'UPDATE' (existing memory modified), 'DELETE' (old memory invalidated), 'NONE' (no change).
event.title: Event

id.description: Unique identifier for the memory event (e.g., 'mem_01JF8ZS4Y0R0SPM13R5R6H32CJ').
id.title: Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Delete memories
tools.description: Deletes memories matching specified filter criteria; omitting all filters may result in deleting all memories. REQUIRED: At least one of agent_id, user_id, app_id, or run_id must be provided.

agent_id.title: Agent Id

app_id.description: Deletes memories associated with this app ID.
app_id.title: App Id

metadata.description: Deletes memories matching this metadata (JSON string).
metadata.title: Metadata

org_id.description: Deletes memories for this organization ID.
org_id.title: Org Id

org_name.description: Deletes memories for this organization name. Deprecated: use `org_id`.
org_name.title: Org Name

project_id.description: Deletes memories for this project ID.
project_id.title: Project Id

project_name.description: Deletes memories for this project name. Deprecated: use `project_id`.
project_name.title: Project Name

run_id.description: Deletes memories associated with this run ID.
run_id.title: Run Id

user_id.description: Deletes memories associated with this user ID.
user_id.title: User Id

successful.title: Successful

project_name.description: Filter entities by project name; this field is deprecated, prefer using `project_id` for more stable filtering.

Entity model representing a user, agent, app, or run in the mem0 API.

This model represents the complete entity structure as returned by the

created_at.title: Created At

tools.name: Perform semantic search on memories
tools.description: Searches memories semantically using a natural language query (required if `only_metadata_based_search` is false) and/or metadata filters. REQUIRED: At least one of agent_id, user_id, app_id, or run_id must be provided. When `only_metadata_based_search` is true, the `metadata` parameter is required.

categories.description: Filter memories by a list of categories; returns memories matching at least one category.
categories.title: Categories

fields.description: Specific field names for inclusion in response for each memory; if empty/unprovided, all fields are returned.
fields.title: Fields

filter_memories.description: If true, strictly applies all provided metadata filters (e.g., `user_id`, `agent_id`, `categories`).
filter_memories.title: Filter Memories

metadata.description: A dictionary of key-value pairs to filter memories. Only memories matching all key-value pairs in the provided metadata will be returned.
metadata.title: Metadata

only_metadata_based_search.description: If true, search uses only metadata fields, and the `query` field is ignored.
only_metadata_based_search.title: Only Metadata Based Search

org_id.description: Filter memories by organization ID.
org_id.title: Org Id

org_name.description: Filter memories by organization name (deprecated; use `org_id` instead).
org_name.title: Org Name

output_format.description: Specifies the output format for results. 'v1.0' is used if not provided. Supported: 'v1.0', 'v1.1'.
output_format.title: Output Format

project_id.description: Filter memories by project ID.
project_id.title: Project Id

project_name.description: Filter memories by project name (deprecated; use `project_id` instead).
project_name.title: Project Name

query.description: Natural language query to search memories; required if `only_metadata_based_search` is false.
query.title: Query
examples: summary of last week's meeting with Acme Corp

rerank.description: If true, applies an additional reranking step to search results for potentially improved relevance.
rerank.title: Rerank

top_k.description: Maximum number of relevant memory results to return.
top_k.title: Top K

inputParameters.title: PerformSemanticSearchOnMemoriesRequest
inputParameters.description: Defines parameters for searching and filtering memories.

memories.description: Array of memory objects ranked by semantic similarity to the search query.
memories.title: Memories

items.description: Represents a single memory object returned from the search.
items.title: MemoryObject

agent_id.description: The agent ID associated with the memory, if any.
agent_id.title: Agent Id

app_id.description: The app ID associated with the memory, if any.
app_id.title: App Id

categories.description: Categories associated with the memory for classification and organization.
categories.title: Categories

created_at.description: The timestamp when the memory was created, in ISO 8601 format.
created_at.title: Created At

expiration_date.description: The date and time when the memory will expire. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Can be null.
expiration_date.title: Expiration Date

hash.description: Hash of the memory content for deduplication and change detection.
hash.title: Hash

id.description: Unique identifier for the memory.
id.title: Id

immutable.description: Whether the memory is immutable and cannot be modified. Defaults to false.
immutable.title: Immutable

input.description: The conversation input that was used to generate this memory.
input.title: Input

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with the memory. Custom key-value pairs for memory tagging.
metadata.title: Metadata

run_id.description: The run ID associated with the memory, if any. Used to group memories from a specific session or task run.
run_id.title: Run Id

score.description: Relevance score indicating match quality, ranging from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate stronger semantic similarity to the search query.
score.title: Score

updated_at.description: The timestamp when the memory was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.
updated_at.title: Updated At

user_id.description: The identifier of the user associated with this memory.
user_id.title: User Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Retrieve all events for the currently logged in user
tools.description: Retrieves a paginated list of events for the authenticated user, filterable and paginable via URL query parameters. This is a read-only operation that does not modify data. Supported Query Parameters (applied directly to the request URL): - `event_type` (str, optional): Filters events by their type (e.g., 'ADD', 'SEARCH'). - `start_date` (str, optional): Filters events on or after this date (format: YYYY-MM-DD). - `end_date` (str, optional): Filters events on or before this date (format: YYYY-MM-DD). - `page` (int, optional): Specifies the page number for paginated results. - `page_size` (int, optional): Number of events per page (default: 50, max: 100).

inputParameters.title: RetrieveAllEventsForTheCurrentlyLoggedInUserRequest
inputParameters.description: Input model; does not accept request body parameters. Filtering and pagination are via URL query parameters (see action description).

count.description: Total number of events matching the filters.
count.title: Count

next.description: URL pointer to retrieve the next batch of results.
next.title: Next

previous.description: URL pointer to retrieve the prior batch of results.
previous.title: Previous

items.description: Event object containing details about a specific event.
items.title: Event

completed_at.description: Event processing completion time in ISO 8601 format.
completed_at.title: Completed At

created_at.description: Event creation timestamp in ISO 8601 format.
created_at.title: Created At

id.description: Unique event identifier in UUID format.
id.title: Id

metadata.description: Custom metadata attached to the event.
metadata.title: Metadata

results.description: Array of result values from event processing.
results.title: Results

started_at.description: Event processing start time in ISO 8601 format.
started_at.title: Started At

updated_at.description: Most recent modification timestamp in ISO 8601 format.
updated_at.title: Updated At

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Retrieve list of memory events

inputParameters.description: Request schema for `RetrieveListOfMemoryEvents`

count.description: Total count of matching events in the result set.
count.title: Count

next.description: URL for the next page of results in pagination, null if no next page exists.
next.title: Next

previous.description: URL for the previous page of results in pagination, null if no previous page exists.
previous.title: Previous

results.title: Results

items.description:
Represents a single memory event from the Mem0 API.

Attributes:
    id: Unique identifier for the event in UUID format.
    event_type: Type of the event being tracked.
    status: Processing state of the event. Example value: 'PENDING'.
    payload: Event input data structure containing the request parameters.
    metadata: Associated event metadata providing additional context.
    results: Array of event processing outcomes and results.
    created_at: ISO 8601 timestamp when the event was created.
    updated_at: ISO 8601 timestamp when the event was last updated.
    started_at: ISO 8601 timestamp when event processing started.
    completed_at: ISO 8601 timestamp when event processing completed.
    latency: Processing duration in milliseconds.
items.title: MemoryEvent

metadata.title: Metadata

payload.description: Event input data structure containing the request parameters.
payload.title: Payload

results.description: Array of event processing outcomes and results.
results.title: Results

started_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when event processing started.

status.title: Status

updated_at.title: Updated At

tools.name: Retrieve memory list
tools.description: Retrieves a list of memories, supporting pagination and diverse filtering (e.g., by IDs, metadata, keywords, date ranges); ensure dates are ISO 8601 and `page`/`page_size` (if used) are positive integers. REQUIRED: At least one of agent_id, user_id, app_id, or run_id must be provided.

agent_id.description: The unique identifier of the agent associated with the memories to be retrieved.
agent_id.title: Agent Id

app_id.description: The unique identifier of the application associated with the memories.
app_id.title: App Id

categories.description: A list of categories to filter memories by. Memories matching any of the specified categories will be returned.
categories.title: Categories

end_date.description: The end date (inclusive) for filtering memories, typically in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' or 'YYYY-MM-DD').
end_date.title: End Date

fields.description: A list of specific field names to consider during filtering. This might involve checking for the existence of these fields or scoping other filters (e.g., keywords) to them.
fields.title: Fields

keywords.description: Keywords to search for within the memories. The search might be across all text fields or restricted by the `fields` parameter if specified.
keywords.title: Keywords

metadata.description: A dictionary of key-value pairs to filter memories. Only memories matching all key-value pairs in the provided metadata will be returned.
metadata.title: Metadata

org_id.description: The unique identifier of the organization to filter memories by.
org_id.title: Org Id

org_name.description: The name of the organization to filter memories by. This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future version; please use `org_id` instead.
org_name.title: Org Name

page.description: The page number for pagination, starting from 1. Default: 1.
page.title: Page

page_size.description: The number of memories to return per page. Default: 100.
page_size.title: Page Size

project_id.description: The unique identifier of the project to filter memories by.
project_id.title: Project Id

project_name.description: The name of the project to filter memories by. This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future version; please use `project_id` instead.
project_name.title: Project Name

run_id.description: The unique identifier of a specific run or session to filter memories by.
run_id.title: Run Id

start_date.description: The start date (inclusive) for filtering memories, typically in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' or 'YYYY-MM-DD').
start_date.title: Start Date

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user whose memories are to be retrieved.
user_id.title: User Id

tools.name: Search memories with filters
tools.description: Semantically searches memories using a natural language query and mandatory structured filters, offering options to rerank results and select specific fields; any provided `org_id` or `project_id` must reference a valid existing entity.

fields.description: Specific field names to include in returned memory objects (e.g., 'text', 'source', 'metadata.custom_field'). If omitted, all fields are returned.
fields.title: Fields

filters.description: Filters to refine search results. Logical operators (`AND`, `OR`, `NOT`) must be UPPERCASE and take a list of conditions. Comparison operators must be lowercase: `in` (matches any value), `gte` (>=), `lte` (<=), `gt` (>), `lt` (<), `ne` (not equal), `contains`, `icontains` (case-insensitive). Use `*` as wildcard to match any value for a field.
filters.title: Filters

org_id.description: UUID of the organization to scope the memory search; preferred over `org_name`.
org_id.title: Org Id

org_name.description: Deprecated: Name of the organization to scope the memory search. Use `org_id` instead for improved accuracy and stability.
org_name.title: Org Name

project_id.description: UUID of the project to scope the memory search; preferred over `project_name`.
project_id.title: Project Id

project_name.description: Deprecated: Name of the project to scope the memory search. Use `project_id` instead for improved accuracy and stability.
project_name.title: Project Name

query.description: Natural language query for searching memories; primary text for matching.
query.title: Query
examples: latest meeting notes with John Doe

rerank.description: If true, applies a secondary reranking model to initial search results for improved relevance.
rerank.title: Rerank

top_k.description: Maximum number of most relevant search results to return.
top_k.title: Top K

inputParameters.title: SearchMemoriesWithQueryFiltersRequest
inputParameters.description: Defines parameters for searching memories using a query and filters.

results.description: Array of memory objects matching the search query and filters
results.title: Results

items.description: Represents a single memory object returned by the search operation.
items.title: Memory

categories.description: Labels linked to the memory for better organization
categories.title: Categories

created_at.description: Timestamp of memory creation
created_at.title: Created At

expiration_date.description: When memory becomes inactive. Format: YYYY-MM-DD
expiration_date.title: Expiration Date

id.description: Distinctive identifier for the memory
id.title: Id

immutable.description: Whether the memory cannot be modified. Default is false
immutable.title: Immutable

metadata.description: Additional attributes tied to the memory. Can include custom fields like includes, excludes, custom_instructions, etc.
metadata.title: Metadata

updated_at.description: Timestamp of most recent modification
updated_at.title: Updated At

user_id.description: The identifier of the user associated with this memory
user_id.title: User Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.description: Updates text for up to 1000 memories in a single batch, using their UUIDs.

memories.title: Memories

items.title: MemoriesRequest

memory_id.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the memory to be updated.

tools.name: Update project
tools.description: Updates a project by `project_id` within an `org_id`, modifying only provided fields (name, description, custom_instructions, custom_categories); list fields are fully replaced (cleared by `[]`), other omitted/null fields remain unchanged.

custom_categories.description: New list of custom category objects. Fully replaces existing categories; an empty list (`[]`) clears them.
custom_categories.title: Custom Categories

items.description: A custom category object; its specific fields and structure are API-dependent and not predefined.
items.title: CustomCategoriesRequest

custom_instructions.description: New list of custom instructions to guide memory processing. Fully replaces existing instructions; an empty list (`[]`) clears them.
custom_instructions.title: Custom Instructions
examples: ['Prioritize memories related to 'Project Phoenix'.', 'Extract action items and deadlines.']

description.title: Description
examples: Revised plan for Q4 product development, incorporating new market feedback.

org_id.description: Organization's unique identifier.
org_id.title: Org Id

project_id.description: Project's unique identifier to be updated.
project_id.title: Project Id

id.title: Id

members.description: List of members belonging to the project.
members.title: Members

items.title: ProjectMember

role.description: Role of the member in the project.
role.title: Role

project_id.title: Project Id

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the project was last updated.
updated_at.title: Updated At

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful
